articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Pelosi advances impeachment process, clearing way for Trump's trial
articles.description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi didn't get everything she wanted by delaying impeachment articles, but she's not empty-handed, either.
articles.content: The original expectation was that the U.S. House would vote on articles of impeachment against Donald Trump, which would soon be followed by a trial in the U.S. Senate. That’s not quite what happened: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-Calif.) held onto the articl… [+2508 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: WAPO: Bloomberg’s fallback plan is to beat Trump and remake Dem party
articles.description: Mike Bloomberg is trying to pave his own path to victory. But a new report says he has a fallback plan: "Defeat Donald Trump and remake the Democratic Party." Michael Scherer, the Washington Post reporter who wrote that story joins Craig Melvin to discuss Blo…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: CEO of All In Together Lauren Leader: ‘[Warren] stuck her finger on an electrical socket of gender politics.’
articles.description: Co-founder and CEO of All In Together, Lauren Leader, breaks down the current gender politics of the 2020 race with a new claim by Elizabeth Warren that Bernie Sanders told her that a woman can’t win the presidency.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep. Quigley talks Speaker Pelosi’s recent updates on impeachment
articles.description: Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced the House will likely take its last votes on impeachment tomorrow, setting up the Senate to start its trial of President Trump. Democratic Representative Mike Quigley joins Craig Melvin to discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Pompeo skips hearing on Soleimani strike
articles.description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo was invited to answer questions about the Iran strike before the House Foreign Affairs Committee, but he declined to appear. Chairman Eliot Engel said he is considering subpoenaing Pompeo.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Frontline dives into the divisive politics of the last decade
articles.description: A new PBS documentary explores how and why the nation has become so split among political lines and how President Trump took advantage of that. Stephanie Ruhle is joined by a writer from the series, Mike Wiser, former Congressman David Jolly, and former Deput…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: AG Barr is the president's sword and shield, say the New Yorker
articles.description: 11 months after being sworn, AG William Barr is the most feared, criticized and effective member of Trump’s cabinet, according to new reporting from the New Yorker. David Rohde joins Morning Joe to discuss.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Tuesday's Campaign Round-Up, 1.14.20
articles.description: Today's installment of campaign-related news items from across the country.
articles.content:
Today’s installment of campaign-related news items from across the country.
* The latest Monmouth poll out of Iowa found Joe Biden leading the Democrats presidential field with 24% support, though the next three candidates are close behind. Bernie Sanders wa… [+1851 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Steyer: Dem nominee needs 'judgment, not experience'
articles.description: Tom Steyer, businessman and 2020 Democratic presidential candidate, joins Hallie Jackson for an update on his campaign as he prepares to take the debate stage Tuesday night. Criticized by his rivals for using his wealth to his advantage, Steyer argues that it…

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Polls show sizable public support for Trump's impeachment
articles.description: Trump keeps arguing that "the people" oppose his impeachment. I guess it depends on which "people" we're referring to.
articles.content: To hear Donald Trump tell it, his congressional detractors are committing political suicide by pursuing impeachment against him. The president recently published tweets arguing, [T]he American people have had it with this, and, The more people learn about imp… [+2110 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. Baldwin gives walkthrough of start of impeachment trial
articles.description: Senator Tammy Baldwin (D-WI) gives Hallie Jackson a look into the start of President Trump's impeachment trial. She says the first formalities are expected to begin on Thursday with the trial itself beginning the following week.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep Krishnamoorthi: More witnesses, evidence will be at Senate trial
articles.description: Congressman Raja Krishnamoorthi (D-IL) joins Hallie Jackson after he sat in on a meeting with the Democratic caucus to discuss the impeachment process. Krishnamoorthi says Dems are "united and resolute" on the topic and predicts that if Adam Schiff and Jerrol…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sources: Pelosi not naming impeachment managers today, articles to be sent to Senate Wednesday
articles.description: Sources in the House Caucus meeting tell NBC News that House Speaker Nancy Pelosi told members that the House will likely vote Wednesday to send the two articles of impeachment against President Donald Trump to the Senate. Pelosi on Wednesday will also name t…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: How one Oregon town embodies America’s working-class crisis
articles.description: The rural, working class town of Yamhill, Oregon is facing its own humanitarian crisis, much like other small towns in the United States. Nicholas Kristof and Sheryl WuDunn discuss their findings in the new book 'Tightrope'.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Analysis: Yang's message connecting with men who feel forgotten
articles.description: What do a Silicon Valley CEO, a Bernie Bro, and a conservative news anchor have in common? Andrew Yang. Author and NBC THINK Contributor Liz Plank and Washington Post National Political Reporter Robert Costa join Stephanie Ruhle to explain.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Trump: 'It doesn't really matter' whether...
articles.description: Trump has gone from shifting and contradictory claims about the motivation behind an airstrike to arguing that the motivation itself "doesn't really matter."
articles.content:
Nearly two weeks ago, Donald Trump authorized an airstrike in Iraq that killed Iranian Gen. Qassem Soleimani, risking a war, creating new threats, and bringing new instability to Middle East. The rational for the military offensive has been … complicated.
